handlers.name: onKeyDown
handlers.label: On Key Down Event
handlers.description: This event is triggered when the key was pressed.

handlers.name: onDisplayAssignment
handlers.description: This handler can contain logic to determine if the autocomplete component should be visible. When the handler returns true, the autocomplete will be displayed.
handlers.label: Visibility Logic

handlers.name: onLabelAssignment
handlers.description: This handler can contain logic to determine the label for the component.
handlers.label: Label Logic

handlers.name: onValueAssignment
handlers.description: This handler can contain logic to determine the value of the component. The autocomplete value is what the user enters or using this handler your logic can determine it.
handlers.label: Value Logic

handlers.name: onPlacesPredictionsAssignment
handlers.description: This handler can contain logic to determine the autocomplete predictions settings for the component.
handlers.label: Autocomplete Predictions

handlers.name: onQueryPredictionsAssignment
handlers.description: This handler can contain logic to determine the search box predictions settings for the component.
handlers.label: Search Box Predictions

handlers.name: onPlaceholderAssignment
handlers.description: This handler can contain logic to define a component placeholder. An autocomplete placeholder is what the user sees before filling in the autocomplete or using this handler, your logic can determine this.
handlers.label: Placeholder Logic

handlers.name: onReadOnlyStateAssignment
handlers.description: This handler can contain logic to determine if the autocomplete component should be read-only. When the handler returns true, the autocomplete component becomes read-only.
handlers.label: Read-Only State Logic

handlers.name: onDisabledStateAssignment
handlers.description: This handler can contain logic to determine if the autocomplete component should be disabled. When the handler returns true, the autocomplete component becomes disabled.
handlers.label: Disabled State Logic

handlers.name: onRequiredStateAssignment
handlers.description: Using this handler you can dynamically configure the autocomplete component as required. A required component prevents form submission until it has a value.
handlers.label: Required State Logic

name: Block

handlers.name: onTooltipTextAssignment
handlers.label: Tooltip Text Logic
handlers.description: This is a handler for the logic to determine what text should be shown in the tooltip.

handlers.name: onContainerDataAssignment
handlers.description: Using this handler you can add logic which determines the data model object which should be used by the block. An object returned by the handler becomes the data model
handlers.label: Data Model Logic

handlers.name: onDisplayAssignment
handlers.label: Visibility Logic
handlers.description: This is a handler for the logic to determine if the block should be visible. If the handler returns true, the component will be visible.

handlers.name: onTooltipTextAssignment
handlers.label: Tooltip Text Logic
handlers.description: This is a handler for the logic to determine what text should be shown in the tooltip.

handlers.name: onDisplayAssignment
handlers.label: Visibility Logic
handlers.description: This is a handler for the logic to determine if the button should be visible. If the handler returns true, the button will be displayed.

handlers.name: onLabelAssignment
handlers.label: Label Logic
handlers.description: This is a handler for the logic to determine the value of the button's label. The value returned by the event handler will be used as the button label.

handlers.name: onDisabledStateAssignment
handlers.label: Disabled State Logic
handlers.description: This is a handler for the logic to determine if the button should be disabled. If the handler returns true, the button will be disabled.

handlers.name: onDisplayAssignment
handlers.description: This is a handler for the logic to determine if the chart should be visible. If the handler returns true, the chart will be displayed.
handlers.label: Visibility Logic

handlers.name: onChartNameAssignment
handlers.description: This is a handler for the logic to determine the name of the chart. Value returned by the  handler will be used as the name of the chart.
handlers.label: Chart Name Logic

handlers.name: onDisplayAssignment
handlers.description: This is a handler for the logic to determine if the checkbox should be visible. When the handler returns true, the checkbox becomes visible.
handlers.label: Visibility Logic

handlers.name: onLabelAssignment
handlers.description: This is a handler for the logic to determine checkbox's label. The returned value is assigned to the label.
handlers.label: Label Logic

handlers.name: onCheckedStateAssignment
handlers.description: This is a handler for the logic to determine if the checkbox should be selected. If the handler returns 0, the checkbox is not checked, any other value will select the checkbox.
handlers.label: Checked State Logic

handlers.name: onDisabledStateAssignment
handlers.description: This is a handler for the logic to identify if the checkbox should be disabled. If the event returns true, the checkbox will be disabled.
handlers.label: Disabled State Logic

handlers.name: onDelete
handlers.label: On Delete
handlers.description: TODO

handlers.name: onDisplayAssignment
handlers.label: Visibility Logic
handlers.description: This handler fired when the delete icon is clicked. If set, the delete icon will be show.

handlers.name: onLabelAssignment
handlers.label: Label Logic
handlers.description: This is a handler for the logic to determine the value of the button's label. The value returned by the event handler will be used as the button label.

handlers.name: onDisabledStateAssignment
handlers.label: Disabled State Logic
handlers.description: This is a handler for the logic to determine if the button should be disabled. If the handler returns true, the button will be disabled.

handlers.name: onRecordSelect
handlers.label: On Record Selected
handlers.description: This event is triggered when the user selects a record in the table. The selected record is provided as a context block.

handlers.name: onRecordsRequest
handlers.label: On Records Request
handlers.description: This handler should return an object with property 'count' what be equal to count of loaded objects and 'items' what should be an array of objects with the same structure as the selected table.

handlers.name: onObjectCreate
handlers.label: On Record Created
handlers.description: This event is triggered when a new record (object) is created in the Data Table. The new object is provided as a context block for the event handler

handlers.name: onObjectUpdate
handlers.label: On Object Update
handlers.description: This event is triggered when a record (object) is edited in the Data Table. The event handler receives both old version of the object and the new (modified) version of it.

handlers.name: onObjectDelete
handlers.label: On Object Delete
handlers.description: This event is triggered when a record (object) is deleted from the Data Table. The event handler receives the object being deleted in a context block.

handlers.name: onDisplayAssignment
handlers.label: Visibility Logic
handlers.description: This is a handler for the logic to determine if the Data Table should be visible. When the event handler returns true, the Data Table will be visible.

handlers.name: onTitleAssignment
handlers.label: Title Logic
handlers.description: This is a handler for the logic to determine the title for the Data Table.

handlers.name: onTableNameAssignment
handlers.label: Table Name Logic
handlers.description: This is a handler for the logic to determines the name of the table which the Data Table works with.

handlers.name: onWhereClauseAssignment
handlers.label: Where Clause Logic
handlers.description: This is a handler for the logic to determine the where clause used to fetch data from the table

handlers.name: onSearchingAssignment
handlers.label: Search Enabled Logic
handlers.description: Using this handler you can control the visibility of the search bar in the data table. When the handler returns true, the search bar is enabled.

handlers.name: onSortingAssignment
handlers.label: Sorting Enabled Logic
handlers.description: Using this handler you can control whether sorting is enabled in the data table. When the handler returns true, sorting is enabled.

handlers.name: onFilteringAssignment
handlers.label: Filtering Enabled Logic
handlers.description: Using this handler you can control whether filtering is enabled in the data table. When the handler returns true, filtering is enabled.

handlers.name: onPagingAssignment
handlers.label: Paging Control Logic
handlers.description: Using this handler you can control whether paging is enabled in the data table. When the handler returns true, paging is enabled.

handlers.name: onRealTimeAssignment
handlers.label: Real Time Control Logic
handlers.description: Using this handler you can control whether real-time data synchronization with the server is enabled in the data table. When the handler returns true, real-time data synchronization is enabled.

handlers.name: onAllowAddAssignment
handlers.label: Enable New Item Logic
handlers.description: Using this handler you can control whether adding new items in the data table is allowed. When the handler returns true, the data table displays an icon which enabled new item creation.

handlers.name: onAllowEditAssignment
handlers.label: Enable Editing Logic
handlers.description: Using this handler you can control whether editing in the data table is allowed. When the handler returns true, data table records can be edited inside of the component.

handlers.name: onAllowDeleteAssignment
handlers.label: Enable Deletion Logic
handlers.description: Using this handler you can control whether deletion in the data table is allowed. When the handler returns true, data table records can be deleted in the component.

handlers.name: onColumnsAssignment
handlers.label: Columns Logic
handlers.description: Using this handler you can control what columns are displayed by the data table.

handlers.name: onDisplayAssignment
handlers.description: This is a handler for the logic to determine if the component should be visible. If the handler returns true, the component will be displayed.
handlers.label: Visibility Logic

handlers.name: onLabelAssignment
handlers.description: This is a handler for the logic to determine the value of the component's label.
handlers.label: Label Logic

handlers.name: onValueAssignment
handlers.description: This is a handler for the logic to determine the date/time value of the component.
handlers.label: Value Logic

handlers.name: onOutlinedStateAssignment
handlers.description: This is a handler for the logic to determine if the component should be outlined - displayed as an input component with a border around it.
handlers.label: Outlined State Logic

handlers.name: onReadOnlyStateAssignment
handlers.description: This is a handler for the logic to determine if the component should behave as a read-only component.
handlers.label: ReadOnly State Logic

handlers.name: onDisabledStateAssignment
handlers.description: This is a handler for the logic to determine if the component should be in the disabled state.
handlers.label: Disabled State Logic

handlers.name: onRequiredStateAssignment
handlers.description: This is a handler for the logic to determine if the component must require a date/time to be selected.
handlers.label: Required State Logic

handlers.name: onDisplayAssignment
handlers.label: Visibility Logic
handlers.description: This is a handler where you can determine divider's visibility. If the handler returns true, the divider will be visible.

name: Features Grid
File Uploader Button

handlers.name: onBeforeUpload
handlers.description: This event is triggered before selected files are uploaded to the server.
handlers.label: on Before Upload

handlers.name: onUploadSuccess
handlers.description: This event is triggered when file(s) upload succeeds.
handlers.label: on Upload Success

handlers.name: onUploadFail
handlers.description: This event is triggered if the upload of the file(s) results in an error.
handlers.label: on Upload Failed

handlers.name: onDisplayAssignment
handlers.description: This is a handler where you can determine file uploader's visibility. If the handler returns true, the file uploader will be visible.
handlers.label: Visibility Logic

handlers.name: onDirectoryAssignment
handlers.description: This is a handler where you can determine the path of the directory where the file(s) will be uploaded to.
handlers.label: Target Directory Logic

handlers.name: onFileNameAssignment
handlers.description: This is a handler where you can determine the name of the file which it will be saved with. If the component is configured for multiple file upload, the handler is invoked for each selected file.
handlers.label: File Name Logic

handlers.name: onButtonLabelAssignment
handlers.description: This is a handler where you can determine the label of the file uploader button.
handlers.label: Button Label Logic

handlers.name: onUploadSuccessMsgAssignment
handlers.description: This is a handler where you can determine the text of the message presented to the user when file(s) upload is successful.
handlers.label: Upload Success Message Logic

handlers.name: onUploadFailMsgAssignment
handlers.description: This is a handler where you can determine the text of the message presented to the user when file(s) upload results in an error.
handlers.label: Upload Fail Message Logic

handlers.name: onUploadProgressMsgAssignment
handlers.description: This is a handler where you can determine the text of the message presented to the user when the upload is in progress.
handlers.label: Upload Progress Message Logic

handlers.name: onDisabledStateAssignment
handlers.description: This is a handler where you can determine whether the file uploader component should be enabled or disabled. If the handler returns true, the component will be disabled.
handlers.label: Disabled State Logic

html:
<button data-button-label="Upload File"
        data-variant="contained"
        data-size="medium"
        data-directory=""
        data-accept="image/*"
        data-upload-success-msg="Uploaded!"
        data-upload-fail-msg="Could not upload!"
        data-upload-progress-msg="Uploading..."
        style="margin:20px;"></button>

name: Form

handlers.name: onContainerDataAssignment
handlers.description: Using this handler you can set the data model for the form to trigger the data binding for all form's components.
handlers.label: Form Data Model Logic

handlers.name: onSubmit
handlers.label: On Submit Event
handlers.description: This event is triggered when the form is submitted - Submit button is clicked or Enter is pressed in a form input component.

handlers.name: onReset
handlers.label: On Reset Event
handlers.description: This event is triggered when the form is reset - the Reset button is clicked.

handlers.name: onDisplayAssignment
handlers.label: Visibility Logic
handlers.description: This handler can be used to determine form's visibility. If the handler returns true, the form is visible.

configurations.title: Google API Key
configurations.description: Is simply dummy text of the printing and typesetting industry. Lorem Ipsum has been the industry's standard dummy text ever since the 1500s

actions.label: Show Popup with content for marker of
Set Gesture Handling Mode in
actions.tooltip: Type of parameters is string. Value is one of 'cooperative', 'greedy', 'none', 'auto'

handlers.name: onZoomChange
handlers.label: On Zoom Event
handlers.description: This event is triggered when the user zooms in or out

handlers.name: onPanChange
handlers.label: On Pan Event
handlers.description: This event is triggered when the user moves the map around (pans)

handlers.name: onDisplayAssignment
handlers.label: Visibility Logic
handlers.description: Using this handler you can determine if the map should be visible. When the handler returns true, the map is visible.

handlers.name: onMapTypeAssignment
handlers.label: Map Type Logic
handlers.description: This is the logic where you can identify the type of the map ('roadmap', 'satelite', 'hybrid', 'terrain').

handlers.name: onMapZoomAssignment
handlers.label: Zoom Level Logic
handlers.description: This is the logic where you can set map's zoom level. Acceptible values are in the range between 1 (World) and 20 (Buildings)

handlers.name: onMapCenterAssignment
handlers.label: Map Center Logic
handlers.description: This is the logic where you can set the map's center coordinates. To set the map's center, return an object with the 'lat' and 'lng' properties containing the latitude and longitude values of the point

handlers.name: onZoomControlAssignment
handlers.label: Zoom Control Logic
handlers.description: This is the handler where you can determine if the zoom controls (+/-) should be visible. Return false to hide zoom control.

handlers.name: onMapTypeControlAssignment
handlers.label: Map Type Control Logic
handlers.description: In this handler you can add logic which determines if the map type control should be visible. If the handler returns true the map type control is displayed.

handlers.name: onScaleControlAssignment
handlers.label: Scale Control Logic
handlers.description: In this handler you can add logic to determine if the scale control should be visible. Return true to display the control.

handlers.name: onStreetViewControlAssignment
handlers.label: Street View Control Logic
handlers.description: In this handler you can add logic to determine if the street view control should be visible. Return true to display the control.

handlers.name: onRotateControlAssignment
handlers.label: On Rotate Control Assignment
handlers.description: In this handler you can add logic to determine if the map rotate control should be visible. This control applies to the street view and lets the user to rotate the street view. Return true to display the control.

handlers.name: onFullscreenControlAssignment
handlers.label: Fullscreen Control Logic
handlers.description: In this handler you can add the logic to determine if the full screen control should be visible. Return true to display the control.

handlers.name: onTrafficAssignment
handlers.label: Show Traffic Logic
handlers.description: In this handler you can add the logic to determine if the traffic should be visible. Return true to display the traffic.

handlers.name: onScrollWheelAssignment
handlers.label: Scroll Wheel Logic
handlers.description: In this handler you can add the logic to determine if zooming on the map using a mouse scroll wheel. Return true to available scroll wheel.

handlers.name: onGestureHandlingAssignment
handlers.label: Gesture Handling Logic
handlers.description: In this handler you can add the logic to determine the gesture handling logic. Return 'cooperative', 'greedy', 'auto' or 'none' to change gesture handling mode.

handlers.name: onPointsAssignment
handlers.label: Markers Logic
handlers.description: In this handler you can add the logic to identify points on the map which should have markers. The handler should return a list of objects, where each object has the 'lat' and 'lng' properties with the corresponding latitude and longitude values.

handlers.name: onMarkerClick
handlers.label: On Marker Click Event
handlers.description: This event is triggered when the user click on a marker on the map

handlers.name: onTooltipTextAssignment
handlers.label: Tooltip Text Logic
handlers.description: This is a handler for the logic to determine what text should be shown in the tooltip.

handlers.name: onDisplayAssignment
handlers.label: Visibility Logic
handlers.description: This is a handler for the logic to determine if the icon should be visible. When the handler returns true, the icon is displayed.

handlers.name: onIconAssignment
handlers.label: Icon Logic
handlers.description: This is a handler for the logic to determine what icon to display. The handler should return a string which is the name of an icon. For the list of available names see the 'CHANGE' popup for the icon component.

handlers.name: onDisplayAssignment
handlers.label: Visibility Logic
handlers.description: This is a handler for the logic to determine if the iframe should be visible. When the handler returns true, the iframe becomes visible.

handlers.name: onSourceUrlAssignment
handlers.label: Source URL Logic
handlers.description: This is a handler for the logic to determine the source URL of the iframe. When the handler returns a URL (as a string), the iframe uses it to render the content from the URL.

handlers.name: onLoad
handlers.label: On Load Event
handlers.description: This event is triggered before the image is retrieved from the source URL.

handlers.name: onError
handlers.label: On Error Event
handlers.description: This event is triggered when the image fails to load from the source URL.

handlers.name: onDisplayAssignment
handlers.label: Visibility Logic
handlers.description: This handler can contain logic to determine if the image should be visible. When the handler returns true, the image becomes visible.

handlers.name: onSourceUrlAssignment
handlers.label: Source URL Logic
handlers.description: This handler can contain logic to determine the source URL for the image.

handlers.name: onKeyDown
handlers.label: On Key Down Event
handlers.description: This event is triggered when the key was pressed.

handlers.name: onDisplayAssignment
handlers.description: This handler can contain logic to determine if the input component should be visible. When the handler returns true, the input will be displayed.
handlers.label: Visibility Logic

handlers.name: onLabelAssignment
handlers.description: This handler can contain logic to determine the label for the component.
handlers.label: Label Logic

handlers.name: onValueAssignment
handlers.description: This handler can contain logic to determine the value of the component. The input's value is what the user enters or using this handler your logic can determine it.
handlers.label: Value Logic

handlers.name: onPlaceholderAssignment
handlers.description: This handler can contain logic to define a component placeholder. An input placeholder is what the user sees before filling in the input or using this handler, your logic can determine this.
handlers.label: Placeholder Logic

handlers.name: onReadOnlyStateAssignment
handlers.description: This handler can contain logic to determine if the input component should be read-only. When the handler returns true, the input component becomes read-only.
handlers.label: Read-Only State Logic

handlers.name: onDisabledStateAssignment
handlers.description: This handler can contain logic to determine if the input component should be disabled. When the handler returns true, the input component becomes disabled.
handlers.label: Disabled State Logic

handlers.name: onRequiredStateAssignment
handlers.description: Using this handler you can dynamically configure the input component as required. A required component prevents form submission until it has a value.
handlers.label: Required State Logic

name: Jumbotron

handlers.name: onTooltipTextAssignment
handlers.label: Tooltip Text Logic
handlers.description: This is a handler for the logic to determine what text should be shown in the tooltip.

handlers.name: onContainerDataAssignment
handlers.description: Using this handler you can add logic which determines the data model object which should be used by the block. An object returned by the handler becomes the data model
handlers.label: Data Model Logic

handlers.name: onDisplayAssignment
handlers.label: Visibility Logic
handlers.description: This is a handler for the logic to determine if the block should be visible. If the handler returns true, the component will be visible.

handlers.name: onDisplayAssignment
handlers.description: Using this handler you can dynamically determine if the component should be visible. When the handler returns true, the component becomes visible.
handlers.label: Visibility Logic

name: Container

handlers.name: onDisplayAssignment
handlers.description: Using this handler you can add logic to dynamically determine if the container should be visible. When the handler returns true, the container is displayed.
handlers.label: Visibility Logic

name: Row

handlers.name: onDisplayAssignment
handlers.description: Using this handler you can add logic to dynamically determine if the row should be visible. When the handler returns true, the row is displayed.
handlers.label: Visibility Logic

handlers.name: onDisplayAssignment
handlers.label: Visibility Logic
handlers.description: Using this handler you can add logic to dynamically determine if the link should be visible. When the handler returns true, the link is displayed.

handlers.name: onTargetPathAssignment
handlers.label: URL Logic
handlers.description: Using this handler you can dynamically determine the URL of the link. The value returned by the handler becomes the URL used by the link.

handlers.name: onTextAssignment
handlers.label: Text Logic
handlers.description: Using this handler you can dynamically determine the text displayed by the link. The value returned by the handler becomes the text which the link displays.

handlers.name: onEnter
handlers.label: On Page Enter
handlers.description: This event is fired when the page is loaded or reloaded.

handlers.name: onLeave
handlers.label: On Page Leave
handlers.description: This event is fired when the user navigates away from the page to another page or away from the application.

handlers.name: onScroll
handlers.label: On Page Scroll
handlers.description:
This event is triggered when the user scrolls the page up or down.
Handler is triggered only if overflow is selected as scroll or auto

handlers.name: onResize
handlers.label: On Page Resize
handlers.description: This event is triggered when the user resizes the page size

handlers.name: onTitleAssignment
handlers.label: Page Title Logic
handlers.description: Using this handler you can add logic to dynamically determine the title of the page. Value returned by the handler is the page title which will be show in the browser tab.

name: Panel

handlers.name: onTooltipTextAssignment
handlers.label: Tooltip Text Logic
handlers.description: This is a handler for the logic to determine what text should be shown in the tooltip.

handlers.name: onContainerDataAssignment
handlers.description: Using this handler you can add logic which determines the data model object which should be used by the block. An object returned by the handler becomes the data model
handlers.label: Data Model Logic

handlers.name: onDisplayAssignment
handlers.label: Visibility Logic
handlers.description: This is a handler for the logic to determine if the block should be visible. If the handler returns true, the component will be visible.

handlers.name: onDisplayAssignment
handlers.label: Visibility Logic
handlers.description: Using this handler you can add logic to dynamically determine if the paragraph should be visible. When the handler returns true, the paragraph is displayed.

handlers.name: onContentAssignment
handlers.label: Content Logic
handlers.description: Using this handler you can add logic to dynamically determine the content displayed by the component. Value returned by the handler is the content which will be rendered.

handlers.name: onDisplayAssignment
handlers.label: Visibility Logic
handlers.description: This handler can contain logic to determine if the QR Code should be visible. When the handler returns true, the QR Code becomes visible.

handlers.name: onValueAssignment
handlers.label: Value Logic
handlers.description: This handler can contain logic to determine the source Data for the QR Code.

handlers.name: onDisplayAssignment
handlers.description: Using this handler you can add logic to dynamically determine if the radio button should be visible. When the handler returns true, the radio button is displayed.
handlers.label: Visibility Logic

handlers.name: onNameAssignment
handlers.description: With this handler you can dynamically set the radio button name.
handlers.label: Name Logic

handlers.name: onLabelAssignment
handlers.description: Using this handler you can add the logic to assign a label to the radio button. The value returned by the handler will be used as the label.
handlers.label: Label Logic

handlers.name: onValueAssignment
handlers.description: Using this handler you can assign a value to the radio button. The value can be used for two purposes - 1) associating a value with the radio button and 2) using the value in the 'Checked Value Logic' handler.
handlers.label: Value Logic

handlers.name: onCheckedValueAssignment
handlers.description: Using this handler you can add logic to determine if the radio button (as a part of a radio group) should be checked. When the value for this property (either through the databinding or the logic) matches the value for 'Value Logic', the radio button is selected.
handlers.label: Checked Value Logic

handlers.name: onDisabledStateAssignment
handlers.description: Using this handler you can add logic to determine if the radio button should be disabled. When the handler returns true, the component will be disabled.
handlers.label: Disabled State Logic

name: Radio Buttons Group

handlers.name: onChange
handlers.label: On Change Event
handlers.description: This event is triggered when there is a change of the selected radio button in the group. The context argument ('Checked Value') is the value assigned to the selected radio button.

handlers.name: onDisplayAssignment
handlers.label: Visibility Logic
handlers.description: Using this handler you can add logic to dynamically determine if the radio button group should be visible. When the handler returns true, the group is displayed.

handlers.name: onNameAssignment
handlers.label: Name Logic
handlers.description: TBD

handlers.name: onCheckedValueAssignment
handlers.label: Checked Value Logic
handlers.description: Using this handler you can dynamically determine which radio button in the group should be selected. To select a radio button in the group, the handler should return the value assigned to a radio button which should be selected.

itemHandlers.name: onDisplayAssignment
itemHandlers.label: Visibility Logic
itemHandlers.description: This is a handler for the logic to determine if the block should be visible. If the handler returns true, the component will be visible.

handlers.name: onDisplayAssignment
handlers.description: Using this handler you can add logic to determine if this select component should be visible. When the handler returns true, the component is displayed.
handlers.label: Visibility Logic

handlers.name: onLabelAssignment
handlers.description: Using this handler you can dynamically assign a label displayed in the selection box. When the handler returns a string, it is used as the label.
handlers.label: Label Logic

handlers.name: onOptionsAssignment
handlers.description: Using this handler you can return a collection of options provided by the component.
handlers.label: Options Logic

handlers.name: onValueAssignment
handlers.description: Using this handler you can add logic to make a programmatic selection of one of the options. The handler should return the value assigned to the option which the logic would like to select.
handlers.label: Value Logic

handlers.name: onDisabledStateAssignment
handlers.description: Using this handler you can determine if the select component should be disabled. When the handler returns true, the select component becomes disabled.
handlers.label: Disabled State Logic

handlers.name: onRequiredStateAssignment
handlers.description: Using this handler you can add logic to determine if the component should require a value. Required components prevent form submission until a value is selected. When the handler returns true, selection in the component becomes required.
handlers.label: Required State Logic

name: Slider

handlers.name: onDisplayAssignment
handlers.description: Using this handler you can add logic to dynamically determine if the slider should be visible. When the handler returns true, the slider is displayed.
handlers.label: Visibility Logic

handlers.name: onNameAssignment
handlers.description: With this handler you can dynamically set the slider name.
handlers.label: Name Logic

handlers.name: onValueAssignment
handlers.description: This handler can contain logic to determine the value of the component. The input value is what the user enters or with this handler your logic can define it.
handlers.label: Value Logic

handlers.name: onDisabledStateAssignment
handlers.description: Using this handler you can add logic to determine if the slider should be disabled. When the handler returns true, the component will be disabled.
handlers.label: Disabled State Logic

handlers.name: onDisplayAssignment
handlers.label: Visibility Logic
handlers.description: Using this handler you can add logic to determine if this spinner component should be visible. When the handler returns true, the component is displayed.

handlers.name: onDisplayAssignment
handlers.description: Using this handler you can add logic to determine if this toggle component should be visible. When the handler returns true, the component is displayed.
handlers.label: Visibility Logic

handlers.name: onCheckedStateAssignment
handlers.description: Using this handler you can add logic to determine if the toggle should be checked (turn on). When the handler returns true, the toggle will be in the checked state.
handlers.label: Checked State Logic

handlers.name: onDisabledStateAssignment
handlers.description: Using this handler you can add logic to determine if the toggle should be disabled. When the handler returns true, the component will become disabled.
handlers.label: Disabled State Logic

handlers.name: onDisplayAssignment
handlers.label: Visibility Logic
handlers.description: Using this handler you can add logic to determine if this text component should be visible. When the handler returns true, the component is displayed.

handlers.name: onContentAssignment
handlers.label: Content Logic
handlers.description: Using this handler you can add logic to dynamically set the text content for this component. When the handler returns a value, the component renders it as text.

handlers.name: onDisplayAssignment
handlers.description: Using this handler you can add logic to determine if this text area component should be visible. When the handler returns true, the component is displayed.
handlers.label: Visibility Logic

handlers.name: onLabelAssignment
handlers.description: Using this handler you can add logic to determine the label for the component. Value returned by the handler will be used as the label.
handlers.label: Label Logic

handlers.name: onMaxLengthAssignment
handlers.description: Using this handler you can add logic to determine the maximum length of the text which the component should accommodate. Numeric value returned by the component will be set as the max length.
handlers.label: Max Length Logic

handlers.name: onValueAssignment
handlers.description: Using this handler you can add logic to determine the content of this text area component. Value returned by the handler becomes the content rendered by the component.
handlers.label: Value Logic

handlers.name: onPlaceholderAssignment
handlers.description: Using this handler you can add logic to determine the placeholder for the component. Value returned by the handler will be used as the placeholder.
handlers.label: Placeholder Logic

handlers.name: onReadOnlyStateAssignment
handlers.description: Using this handler you can add logic to determine if the component should be read-only. When the handler returns true, the component becomes read-only.
handlers.label: Read-Only State Logic

handlers.name: onDisabledStateAssignment
handlers.description: Using this handler you can add logic to determine if the component should be disabled. When the handler returns true, the component becomes disabled.
handlers.label: Disabled State Logic

handlers.name: onRequiredStateAssignment
handlers.description: Using this handler you can logic to determine if the component should be required. Required components prevent form submission until a value is entered. When the handler returns true, the component becomes required.
handlers.label: Required State Logic

handlers.name: onDisplayAssignment
handlers.label: Visibility Logic
handlers.description: Using this handler you can add logic to determine if this video component should be visible. When the handler returns true, the component is displayed.

handlers.name: onSourceAssignment
handlers.label: Source URL Logic
handlers.description: Using this handler you can add logic to determine the source URL of the video. Value returned by the handler will be used as the source URL.

handlers.name: onAutoplayAssignment
handlers.label: Autoplay Logic
handlers.description: Using this handler you can add logic to determine if the video should have the autoplay option enabled. When the component returns true, autoplay is enabled.

handlers.name: onControlsAssignment
handlers.label: Controls Logic
handlers.description: Using this handler you can add logic to determine if the playback controls should be visible. When the handler returns true, the playback controls are displayed.

handlers.name: onLoopAssignment
handlers.label: Loop Logic
handlers.description: Using this handler you can add logic to determine if the video should play in a loop. To enable this behavior, the handler should return true.

handlers.name: onMuteAssignment
handlers.description: Using this handler you can add logic to determine if the video should be muted. To mute the video, the handler should return true.
handlers.label: Mute Logic

handlers.name: onBackgroundAssignment
handlers.description: TBD
handlers.label: Background Logic

handlers.name: onModestBrandingAssignment
handlers.label: Modest Branding Logic
handlers.description: [Youtube only] https://developers.google.com/youtube/player_parameters#modestbranding

handlers.name: onShowRelatedAssignment
handlers.label: Show Related Logic
handlers.description: [Youtube only] https://developers.google.com/youtube/player_parameters#rel

handlers.name: onNoCookieAssignment
handlers.label: No Cookie Logic
handlers.description: [Youtube only] https://stackoverflow.com/questions/42555450/how-to-embed-youtube-videos-without-cookies

handlers.name: onColorAssignment
handlers.label: Color Logic
handlers.description: [Vimeo only] https://vimeo.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/360001494447-Using-Player-Parameters
